ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: basic italian conversation skills and basic vocabulary. an introduction to the italian language and a little bit of culture
Foundations of basic Italian: grammar, speaking, vocabulary, culture, etc.
First and foremost, I learned to speak a language I had no experience in prior, but I also gained the desire to go deeper into cultures, histories and other languages as well.
Learned the basics of italian
Learned Italian vocabulary and grammar and written and oral skills.
I was surprised to see how many essays I could write in this class! Speaking in class improved fluency and having writing assignments also solidified my understanding of Italian grammar and syntax.
An introduction to the Italian language and Italian culture!
I learned how to communicate in Italian conversationally and with grammatical accuracy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is great as it is.
Simona is a fantastic instructor and I really appreciated the layout (though sometimes, it felt a bit fast paced).
My teacher was awesome. It would be nice to be able to ask questions in English especially in the early stages of the course

This course did a good job of giving an introduction to Italian without doing too much and overwhelming us. There were a lot of in-class exams, so we were taking exams practically every other week, which was a little fast, but the exams were not too bad and actually reflected the things we practiced in class.
I think its strengths lie in the immersive culture of speaking in class. One thing that can be improved is practicing examples with each new topic on worksheets in preparation for the exams earlier.
It is a very fast-paced course, although I learned a ton throughout the semester. I am looking forward to taking many more Italian classes!

Strengths: high collaboration with other students, exposure to Italian media
Weaknesses: very textbook-centered

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes Italian is a fun language with not a ton of work compared to other languages here.
Absolutely, thorough yet manageable introduction to Italian.

I would definitely recommend this class! If you want to learn Italian, this class is a great way to begin to develop an understanding of the language. Simona was great at explaining the concepts and I definitely feel prepared to take more Italian classes next semester. Overall, it was not too difficult while still being extremely interesting!
Certainly, regardless of interest in becoming advanced in Italian, this course is a must take for anyone interested in getting the basics.
Yes I would, the department is awesome and I learned alot

Yes, Italian is a great language at Yale. You learn a lot in a short amount of time, which can be overwhelming, but the daily and weekly assignments help reinforce it and keep you from falling behind.

Yes! I think this was one of my favorite classes of my semester! Italian is not too difficult to learn (in my opinion), but the challenging parts are made fun its almost like cracking a code. Getting the chance to practice speaking while also learning about the culture of Italy makes for an interesting course.
Yes! Great instructor, and interesting material!
I would recommend this course to anyone just starting out with Italian since it provides a good foundational understanding of basic culture and grammar.
